verses.roman:
prajāpater aṅgirasaḥ
svadhā patnī pitṟn atha
atharvāṅgirasaṁ vedaṁ
putratve cākarot satī

synonyms: prajāpateḥ aṅgirasaḥ—of another prajāpati, known as Aṅgirā; svadhā—Svadhā; patnī—his wife; pitṟn—the Pitās; atha—thereafter; atharva-āṅgirasam—Atharvāṅgirasa; vedam—the personified Veda; putratve—as the son; ca—and; akarot—accepted; satī—Satī.
translation: The prajāpati Aṅgirā had two wives, named Svadhā and Satī. The wife named Svadhā accepted all the Pitās as her sons, and Satī accepted the Atharvāṅgirasa Veda as her son.
